comparisons.ground_truth: Molecular karyotyping by SNP array (Illumina HumanCoreExome-24; resolution 0.5 Mb).
comparisons.model_output: Matched at 16 loci, normal 46,XX karyotype, 500,000 human SNPs analyzed, no genomic abnormalities detected.

comparisons.ground_truth: Molecular karyotyping by SNP array (Illumina Infinium CoreExome-24 v1.1; resolution 0.5 Mb). SNPduo comparison to parental cell (>99.9% identity).
comparisons.model_output: Karyotyping of the PBMCs and iPSC lines was performed using the Infinium CoreExome-24 v1.1 SNP array. The passage number for each iPSC line that was karyotyped are as follows: ASD2-11.5 P4 + 4. The data was compared to the human normal karyotype. SNP array comparisons of PBMC and iPSC lines were performed using SNPduo comparative analysis. No differences were detected between the original PBMC sample and its corresponding iPSC line.

comparisons.model_output: All lines demonstrated a normal karyotype. SNP array comparisons of parental PBMC and iPSC lines showed identical genotype to their corresponding PBMC sample.

comparisons.ground_truth: Molecular karyotyping by SNP array (Illumina Infinium CoreExome-24 v1.1; resolution 0.5 Mb). SNPduo comparison to parental cell (>99.9% identity).
comparisons.model_output: All iPSC lines showed a normal karyotype (with 0.5 Mb resolution) and an identical genotype to their corresponding PBMC sample when analysed by array comparative genomic hybridisation (SNP array), confirming no perturbations in genomic integrity occurred during reprogramming.

comparisons.ground_truth: Karyostat analysis (minimum resolution: 1 MB (losses); 2 MB (gains), 5 MB (LOH/AOH)).
comparisons.model_output: Karyostat assay (CytoScan Optima) indicated normal copy number (2.0 ± 0.3) at all tested loci. No chromosomal aberrations were found in either line.
